Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • AddressBook
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    purpose: This class is responsible for handling all the functions called by the AddressBookApplication class. The functions called depend on the selection the user makes when the menu is displayed.
    Author:
    Bandana Kaur
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddressBook() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void find()
      The find method is responsible for looking up the entry the user wishes to see.
      static void initAddressBookApplication()
      The initAddressBookApplication method is responsible for adding new entries to the address book (TreeMap) after getting all needed information from the user.
      static void list()
      The list method is responsible for printing out all the entries, in alphabetical order, in the address book (TreeMap) to the user.
      static void load()
      The load method is responsible for getting the file name from the user and loading the file.
      void newEntry(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String street, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String state, java.lang.String zip, java.lang.String telephone, java.lang.String email)
      The newEntry method is responsible for taking the parameters and creating an AddressEntry object.
      static void remove()
      The remove method is responsible for deleting an address book entry from the TreeMap which has been specified by the user.
      static void saveAndQuit()
      The saveAndQuit method is responsible for asking the user the name of the file he/she wishes to save the updated address book to.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddressBook

        public AddressBook()

    • Method Detail

      • newEntry

        public void newEntry(java.lang.String firstName,
                     java.lang.String lastName,
                     java.lang.String street,
                     java.lang.String city,
                     java.lang.String state,
                     java.lang.String zip,
                     java.lang.String telephone,
                     java.lang.String email)
        The newEntry method is responsible for taking the parameters and creating an AddressEntry object. It pushes the object on to the TreeMap, which keeps all entries sorted in alphabetical order, by last names.
        Parameters:
        firstName - Is the first name entered by the user.
        lastName - Is the last name entered by the user.
        street - Is the street name entered by the user.
        city - Is the city name entered by the user.
        state - Is the state name entered by the user.
        zip - Is the zip code entered by the user.
        telephone - Is the telephone number entered by the user.
        email - Is the email address entered by the user.

      • load

        public static void load()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        The load method is responsible for getting the file name from the user and loading the file. It is to load and print the address book entries within the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - To handle any exceptions when an error occurs when the file is loaded.

      • initAddressBookApplication

        public static void initAddressBookApplication()
        The initAddressBookApplication method is responsible for adding new entries to the address book (TreeMap) after getting all needed information from the user.

      • remove

        public static void remove()
        The remove method is responsible for deleting an address book entry from the TreeMap which has been specified by the user. It gets the last name of the person whose entry is to be deleted and finds it within the book.

      • find

        public static void find()
        The find method is responsible for looking up the entry the user wishes to see. It gets the last name of the person and searches the address book for full contact information.

      • list

        public static void list()
        The list method is responsible for printing out all the entries, in alphabetical order, in the address book (TreeMap) to the user.

      • saveAndQuit

        public static void saveAndQuit()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        The saveAndQuit method is responsible for asking the user the name of the file he/she wishes to save the updated address book to. It saves the new address book and quits the program.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - To handle any exceptions when an error occurs when saving to the file.
